subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Sweep Tuning of AM Radio Band - FWIW

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

LOL!!  Misty, I didn't want to be the one to say it, but I feel the same wa=
y!!  : )

This sounds so intriguing, but I really don't understand it!  My =
husband is an electrician.  Maybe he'd understand?

I am someone who is ver=
y interested in EVP, but got bored using a digital recorder and just record=
ing voices.  I wanted more than that.  I think you guys understand that.  I=
 want to know everything about it.  I want to experiment.  When someone men=
tioned this board and I checked it out, I loved what I was reading about al=
l of the experimenting and I hope to get involved in it!

Amy
SIPS

  -----=
 Original Message ----- 
  From: Misty Dawn<mailto:bulletbabea@...> 
=
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Wedn=
esday, March 21, 2007 10:49 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Sweep Tuning of=
 AM Radio Band - FWIW



  Thats kind of you to offer Bill =3D) Id say me, =
but I'd need a video instruction book to go with it LOL with you going you =
put this thingy into that thingamajigger. Is there welding involved? (I don=
t do it)

  I KNEW I should have played with the older boys building radios=
 when I was in school. But I was way too shy then and only in grade school =
so I did crafts with the older girls. Advanced classes were interesting but=
 my shyness didnt help. So for the technically challenged (like me) perhaps=
 you could lay out a mock instruction plan with a pic or two?

  I know qui=
te a few on the group dont need it, and probably understand what you are sa=
ying completely. 

  Misty
  kenneth b thomas <kennnthomas2000@...> w=
rote:
    thanks for taking the trouble to look, Bill.

    i have a yahoo =
messenger webcam set up for members of franks-evp only 
    for better expl=
anatios/demonstrations. if anyone wants an evp 
    competent (or wtf) 1n34=
 to plug into their tape machine AND is a 
    member of this group only , =
i'll send them out as long as i can 
    afford it/can spare time. worth th=
e effort IMO for patient detail 
    conscious researchers which evp-ers se=
em to be. the described 
    procedure should work on first or second try f=
or those that can put 
    together crystal receiver and plug it into ampli=
fier.--with smal cap 
    to ground plug, you could even do it with a tape =
recorder. all long 
    wires that can act as antennas can then be removed =
and only diode or 
    diode and tuned circuit employed. whole assembly can=
 be rotated to 
    block out radio stations.

    kthomas

nce when diode is reversed.. diode

rly strong local station was

ise; white noise with larger scale 
    order 
    > > appearing and vanish=
ing- unpredictably , like candle flame- but 
    > > averaging about 3-15 t=
imes per second
    > > 
    > > other am receivers still full of crashing =
static from long gone t-
    > > storm.
    > >

e + audio amp=3D no lightning crashes

    > > line noi=
se. no fluorescent light 60hz buzz.

r awhile by

r junction

 low amplitude. 
    noise

nt source seems to work 
    better

 match or soldering on there 
    while

se till i get something that sounds good

arger scale prigogine fluctuations up to 75mv.

ot completely random--pinked up due to
